Vladimir Putin's statement in 2014 that Crimeia should be annexed to Russia is based on the idea that Crimean people should be subject to the same authority as the rest of Russia. This statement is a reflection of the Russian Federation's belief that Crimean people are part of their country, and that Crimean people should be subject to the same laws and regulations as the rest of Russia. This belief is not unique to Russia, as many countries have similar views on their own territories.
